projectInfo.name: eclipse_SDK
projectInfo.credits: This report contains data retrieved from the National Vulnerability Database: http://nvd.nist.gov

vulnerability.name: CVE-2010-2542
vulnerability.cwe: CWE-119 Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
vulnerability.description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the is_git_directory function in setup.c in Git before 1.7.2.1 allows local users to gain privileges via a long gitdir: field in a .git file in a working copy.

vulnerability.name: CVE-2008-7271
vulnerability.cwe: CWE-79 Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
vulnerability.description: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in the Help Contents web application (aka the Help Server) in Eclipse IDE, possibly 3.3.2, allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via (1) the searchWord parameter to help/advanced/searchView.jsp or (2) the workingSet parameter in an add action to help/advanced/workingSetManager.jsp, a different issue than CVE-2010-4647.

vulnerability.name: CVE-2010-2542
vulnerability.cwe: CWE-119 Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
vulnerability.description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the is_git_directory function in setup.c in Git before 1.7.2.1 allows local users to gain privileges via a long gitdir: field in a .git file in a working copy.

evidence.name: comment-header
evidence.value: Both Eclipse-LazyStart and Bundle-ActivationPolicy are specified for compatibility with 3.2

vulnerability.cwe: CWE-119 Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
vulnerability.description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the is_git_directory function in setup.c in Git before 1.7.2.1 allows local users to gain privileges via a long gitdir: field in a .git file in a working copy.

vulnerability.name: CVE-2010-2542
vulnerability.cwe: CWE-119 Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
vulnerability.description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the is_git_directory function in setup.c in Git before 1.7.2.1 allows local users to gain privileges via a long gitdir: field in a .git file in a working copy.

evidence.name: comment-dynamicimport
evidence.value: this is only used to allow late binding of the package

evidence.name: comment-header
evidence.value: Both Eclipse-LazyStart and Bundle-ActivationPolicy are specified for compatibility with 3.2

vulnerability.name: CVE-2010-2542
vulnerability.cwe: CWE-119 Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
vulnerability.description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the is_git_directory function in setup.c in Git before 1.7.2.1 allows local users to gain privileges via a long gitdir: field in a .git file in a working copy.

vulnerability.name: CVE-2010-2542
vulnerability.cwe: CWE-119 Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
vulnerability.description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the is_git_directory function in setup.c in Git before 1.7.2.1 allows local users to gain privileges via a long gitdir: field in a .git file in a working copy.

vulnerability.name: CVE-2008-7271
vulnerability.cwe: CWE-79 Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
vulnerability.description: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in the Help Contents web application (aka the Help Server) in Eclipse IDE, possibly 3.3.2, allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via (1) the searchWord parameter to help/advanced/searchView.jsp or (2) the workingSet parameter in an add action to help/advanced/workingSetManager.jsp, a different issue than CVE-2010-4647.

vulnerability.name: CVE-2008-7271
vulnerability.cwe: CWE-79 Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
